title: Decouple LexicalAnalyzer from PrimerGenerator
description:
Refactor System 2 (Lexical Cartography) to separate analysis from output generation. Currently the lexical analysis is tightly coupled to the PrimerGenerator - you can only get a LexicalMap if you also generate a primer section.

## Problem
- LexicalAnalyzer only instantiated when pre_reading_primer=True
- Cannot generate vocabulary sidebar without warm-up section
- Analysis happens inside primer generation, not before it
- Violates single responsibility principle

## Solution
Always run LexicalAnalyzer during transformation, store results in document metadata. Let output features (primer, vocab guide, sidebar) consume the shared analysis.

## Implementation

### 1. Update transformer.py __init__
- Always instantiate self.lexical_analyzer regardless of flags
- Keep PrimerGenerator separate from analyzer

### 2. Update transform_file and transform_to_document
- Call lexical_analyzer.analyze_document(text) FIRST
- Store LexicalMap in document.vocabulary.lexical_map
- Pass LexicalMap TO PrimerGenerator.generate() if primer enabled
- Pass LexicalMap TO TrapGenerator if traps enabled

### 3. Update PrimerGenerator
- Accept LexicalMap as input instead of raw text
- Remove internal LexicalAnalyzer usage
- generate_primer(lexical_map, word_count) signature

### 4. Update TrapGenerator
- Accept LexicalMap for smarter trap word selection
- Use morpheme families for lookalike generation

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] LexicalAnalyzer runs on every transformation
- [ ] LexicalMap stored in document.vocabulary
- [ ] PrimerGenerator consumes pre-computed map
- [ ] --vocab-guide works without --primer
- [ ] Tests verify decoupled behavior

Dynamic Scaffolding Engine - Adaptive Fading System
description:
Implement the 'Adaptive Fading' engine for System 1 (Scaffolding). Currently transformer.py applies the same scaffolding level to an entire document. The Science of Reading requires fading support as words become familiar - if 'philosophy' appears 10 times, dot it the first time (phi·los·o·phy) but leave it plain by the 10th occurrence to force independent recognition.

## Problem
- Static scaffolding applies uniform formatting throughout document
- No tracking of word exposure history across chunks
- Readers never graduate from support for repeated words

## Solution
Create ScaffoldingContext class that tracks word exposure and provides 'mastered' word exclusions to the LLM.

## Implementation

### 1. Create src/anchor_text/core/scaffolding.py
- ScaffoldingContext class with exposure tracking
- Configurable profiles: 'static', 'adaptive', 'aggressive'
- Methods: get_faded_words(), update_exposure(text), reset()
- Exposure thresholds configurable (default: 3 exposures = mastered)

### 2. Update transformer.py _transform_text method
- Initialize ScaffoldingContext before chunk loop
- Pass mastered_words as exclusions to LLM
- Update context after each chunk processed

### 3. Update LLMClient.transform_with_validation
- Accept optional 'exclusions' parameter
- Modify prompt to exclude formatting on mastered words

### 4. Add CLI option
- --adaptive flag to enable dynamic scaffolding
- --fade-threshold N to set exposure count before fading

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] ScaffoldingContext tracks word occurrences
- [ ] Words seen N times excluded from formatting
- [ ] Works correctly across chunk boundaries
- [ ] Tests verify fading behavior
